headline: Cheddar Bay Biscuits
description: These Cheddar bay biscuits are easy to make with Bisquick mix, Cheddar cheese, butter, garlic, parsley, and onion for copycat Red Lobster biscuits.

video.description: Check out these quick and tasty cheddar biscuits.
video.name: Cheddar Bay Biscuits

name: Cheddar Bay Biscuits

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Combine baking mix, water, and cheese in a large bowl; mix until dough comes together. Use a small scoop to portion dough onto the prepared pan.
Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown, 10 to 12 minutes.
While biscuits are baking, combine melted butter, garlic powder, salt, onion powder, and parsley in a small bowl. Brush over hot biscuits.

review.reviewBody: Delicious! I followed others suggestions.: I doubled the cheese (I shredded the cheese myself - didn't buy already shredded). I mixed the garlic powder, salt , onion powder & parsley into the batter. I put the biscuits back in the oven for a couple of minute after brushing them with butter

I liked them alot but a bit putzy to do the mix AND the garlic biscuits but they were good - it was my choice to do both the same day and also didn't have dried milk (expensive) so I did the milk instead of water to the recipe - turned out good and buttery.
So easy and so wonderful! These are a must when we serve crab legs! Thanks!

I followed the recipe exactly as per the video (which added the extra spices into the dough) and it was pretty tasteless. It made 21 biscuits, so I think next time I would add 1cup of cheese. Even the video, the dough looks like it has more cheese than 3oz. I've never been to the Red Lobster, so I don't have anything to compare it with.
They came out perfect and tasted better than the restaurant ones. Thank you all recipes.
Delicious! Didn't bake in my oven, I tried them in my Air Fryer. Kept everything the same except used fresh parsley, chopped.
Yummy! Cheaper than box mix!
I followed all the tweaks in some of the comments and the recipe just did not turn out. Will try again though
I love this recipe! Made exactly as written and my grandson loved it and so did the adults! Will definitely keep this!!
So friggin" good!!! No changes needed. Melt in your mouth as is. Highly recommend.
Not very flavorful; cooking time and temp weren’t enough
These turned out really good. However, I am going to take others suggestions and add some Old Bay next time.
Not make favourite. I don't know what is in baking mix so I added flour and baking powder. The rose and tasted ok but very dense

Made tonight but only made 6 which is another reason I love this sight it allows for changing portions. They were great. I think I needed to cook mine longer, 12 minutes and they weren't brown but they were yummy.
This is perfect, followed exactly.
I cut the recipe in half.
Very good. Will make again.
The flavor was good, but they were pretty flat. Will add a bit of baking soda next time.

Took the advice of other reviewers and used milked instead of water, upped the cheese to 1 cup (maybe could have used a little more & only mixed the dough enough to combine. Also added more seasoning ...to the batter 1 tsp garlic powder, 1 tsp dried parsley, 1/4 tsp salt, 1/4 tsp onion powder and a little old bay seasoning. I also added 1/4 tsp to the butter mixture.
I also added some onion and garlic powder to the dough. Yummy. We had no leftovers.

Where has this recipe been all my life? I found it by accident when I was going through a random person’s saved recipes lol. I’ve made them twice this week. I cut the recipe in half and I also add the the items that go in the butter to the batter as well as the butter.
Yes, but will add more cheese and possibly a jalapeño!

Were good, I added the old bay and garlic and onion powders to the mix like some said to do, I think the difference in being more "authentic" is that they either drown these in butter or actually add the butter to the dough before baking which I will try next time. But good recipe overall with the changes.

I used belgium waffle mix and accidentally put the butter mix in before putting it in the oven (drained it off though). Not sure about the taste with bisquick, maybe a little too sweet. Not bad though.

These were really flavorful! I used frozen biscuits instead of making the dough, but brushed with the butter mixture exactly as stated (with 1/4 Old Bay added as per other reviewers) and topped with shredded cheddar. This one's a keeper!
I mixed all dry ingredients together, used 1/2 cup butter, 3/4 cup greek yogurt, and 1/2 cup water for the wet ingredients. Texture turned out smooth and soft like no biscuit i have ever had before.
I didn’t make any changes, They were great.
Too many I did this, I did that. I had a package of famous brand Cheddar Bay Biscuits, but I needed the biscuit seasoning. I used the bought mix, then added topping. Yum, end of story for me.
They were great once I figured out you need to add the spices to the dough as well as brushing on top, otherwise they are bland inside.

To make these taste like Red Lobster Cheddar Bay Biscuits, cut one stick of COLD butter into the dry biscuit mix, leaving pea-sized pieces of butter, and add the remaining ingredients being careful not to overmix. When it bakes that butter melts and leaves an airy light biscuit. Still make the buttery topping, and put over the warm biscuits.

Just FYI....(I live in British Columbia Canada & there isn't ONE Red Lobster in the whole province.....so I'm devastated! but...) you can buy a 1.28kg box of Red Lobster Cheddar Bay Biscuit Mix made by Continental Mills Inc. Seattle WA. It's made exclusively for Red Lobster & has 4 packs of biscuit mix that make 10 biscuits each & pkts. of garlic herb blend to mix w/melted butter to put on top. All you add is shredded cheddar and water & butter. The are EXACTLY like what they serve at the restaurant! Yummy!!!
Fabulous. I was generous with the seasoning but they are amazing.

Just made these tonight.I used bisquick mix for my baking mix.We LOVE these!Having them for dinner and I already need to make another batch because the kids came to "taste" the first batch!Dinner is not even done yet!I didnt add anything extra.Followed the recipe as written.My house smells sooo good too!.Will be a household favorite from now on
These biscuits were very good, but not as good as that seafood restaurant. When I make it again I think I may add more cheese. I will use the recipe again.
These biscuits are the best! I love making them.
Very good

Really good and really easy...my kind of recipe. I did not read the recipe completely and added the garlic and onion powder into the baking mix...oops. Added the correct amount of garlic and onion powder to melted butter and it was quite savory. So the extra worked out very well. Thanks for the recipe
It was delicious and I will make it again

soft inside and crunchy outside. The cheese was just perfect. I didn't have a pastry brush so I just dipped each as they came out of the oven. Sprinkled old bay seasoning after dipping in butter sauce.
These turned out pretty good. I took the advise of adding the Bay seasoning and that was a great add in. Think I may add more cheese in next batch.
Thank you!!! My box of mix was missing the seasoning packet and I can’t have the biscuits without. You saved the day!

I make these CB Biscuits about every three months. However, I do add Old Bay seasoning and use milk or H&H vs. the water. Prior to baking, I brush them with: melted butter, fresh minced garlic, fresh parsley and chives. This gives them a nice crispy top and very moist interrior. After cooling, I wrap them in 2's in plastic wrap and put all in the freezer bag. Pull two out, defrost and bake on 300 for about 5 minutes.

personal opinion, they meant to say 3 c. baking mix rather than 4... Tried it the way it's written. Okay, I used a gluten free 1 for 1 baking mix, and my water/milk was coconut milk made from coconut powder according to directions, and if anything it was lighter rather than heavier than milk, and probably extra cheese, more than 3 oz. It came out a very dry dough, so I added about 3 tbsp. plain yogurt to moisten it up a bit, but still not enough. Was very crumbly, just barely holding together, and after baking sufficient time, tasted doughy, and could not taste the cheese much either. Also made more than 20 rather large biscuits. So that's why I think they meant "3 cups" baking mix. I may try it again someday, with that adjustment.

The video mentions Old Bay Seasoning but the recipe does not show it.
I prefer fresh garlic and onion minced real fine and a salt free seafood seasoning. The Spice Hunter has a great one.
Made with Old bay seasoning like another suggestion on here.
Family loved them. The video showed extra ingredients added before baking, so I plan to try that next time. They didn't brown like the picture but tasted good.
I tried it and they worked really well. very simple recipe

Excellent!!! These tasted EXACTLY like the Red Lobster version! I can't believe so simple. So happy I tried, will use often I am sure. The only thing I did differently was to use 1 teaspoon of Johnny's Garlic Seasoning to flavor the butter, because I was too lazy to gather the other flavors. Thank you for this!
Great recipe. Did sharp grated cheddar, and grated Monterrey jack. Would make it again
The best! Just like Red Lobster biscuits.

Great! Tastes just like the box mix of the Red Lobster biscuits. I added a bit more seasoning (more garlic powder and old bay spice) to the mix like others suggested and the flavour was spot on. Only thing was that it took almost twice as long of a cooking time for mine to become browned, which may have been because of their size.

These were barely edible and we wound up throwing them out. It seems like 3 oz is not nearly enough shredded cheese and I think the biscuits would be better with seasoning in them. They didn't bake in the amount of time shown either. I followed this recipe exactly and it just did not turn out well.
Made these exactly as called out. Really good. Next time I might add more cheese.
These were very good. I used buttermilk instead of water, 1- cup of cheese, rolled them to 1/2-inch, and put them back in oven for for a few minutes after brushing with butter. Very tasty!

It is hard to mess this recipe up, so I love it. You can sub cheese type and different seasonings and still get a really great dinner biscuit. Definitely more affordable than paying $3 for a little bay biscuit box mix. Staple recipe for me.
These biscuits are amazing and a must try, mmm mmm mmm!

I used a commercial, licensed mix for Cheddar Bay Biscuits the night before an loved them so much I wanted to be able to make them myself. I followed the instructions and the ingredient list was surprisingly basic, but the results were spectacular. Everyone loved them and said it was a new family regular. Cheddar Bay Biscuits ftw!
Really nice and really simple.
I follow the recipes as ordered....except i used buttermilk instead of water...
Awesome biscuits at my finger tips!

The butter sauce was yummy! I think I added too much water; my biscuits were big and spread a lot. Versatile, since I served these with soup, as sausage biscuits in the morning, and then as dumplings for stew the next day. I may try what others have suggested and add a little Old Bay if I'm serving with seafood.
Super easy to make and my husband and son loved them. Made them a few times now and this recipe has never failed!
Quick and easy. We have them often.

This is a simple delicious recipe. Easy to make. I used bisquick instead of self-rising flour. I added the old bay seasoning to the dry mixture. I also used half milk and half water for the liquid. I melted the butter in the milk and water in the microwave. 
Easy peasy!! Will make again!
I added the Old Bay. Boy did that make it better. Will make again.
Delicious! I have made them several times
Delicious! I have made them several times
The biscuit flavor was exactly what I expected however they did not rise as fluffy as I expected using the Jiffy baking mix.
These were super easy and delicious!

I made these according to the recipe directions and they were delicious. The 1 1/3 cups of water was a little too much for the 4 cups of biscuit mix and I had to sprinkle in some extra mix to make the dough stop being sticky and turn soft and pliable. I would recommend changing the recipe to say add water until the dough forms. I would also go so far as to make extra garlic butter for dipping the biscuits, because it was so good.
Good flavor. I chose the gluten free bisquick baking mix and they came out quite hard but I’m sure the original recipe was better.

I added a dash of old bay seasoning, garlic powder, and onion powder to the dough mixture. Once they were done baking, I put the buttery mixture on top then put them back in the oven for 1 minute and it was amazing!! Tasted just like Red Lobster biscuits!!!
Only change I made was the amount so that I could make a smaller batch
Very good. I made the recipe following the video since the old bay wasn’t in the written instructions.
I added a little extra garlic powder and some pepper, very good, just the right amount of cheese!
I really loved these. I started with small biscuits because I thought I would run out. I still have a half-bag full of biscuits still.
Fantastic
Use the other cheddar biscuit recipe but this butter topping. Yum.

This is a great recipe! I have made this several times now and love it. I have added a little more garlic powder than the recipe calls for though as I like the taste of garlic. The 1st time I made these, I did the drop type biscuit, but wasn't wowed by the "look" of them. Since, each time I've made them, I don't roll them out either, but I've shaped the dough the square, then cut the square into 8 smaller squares.
Tasted just like the Red Lobster Cheddar Bay Biscuit box mix. Everyone who tried it loved it.

Cut the recipe in half for the two of us and it still made too many biscuits. I did not add the spices to the biscuits directly but did use them as directed in the butter used to finish them. 

They were a hit although I think Ill increase the cheese next time.. I used extra sharp cheddar.

I had purchased the red lobster brand mix at costco and was annoyed when I got home and found out that the cost of making the biscuits was just about doubled by the cheese I had to add to the mix. This version is every bit as good as the mix and a lot cheaper.
Yummy and easy!
I will add a bit of smoked paprika,, but I loved it
yummy
Love this recipe. I did add 1/2 tsp. of garlic powder into the dough. I also used milk instead of water. Family loved this with soup, or chili.
Yummy but really salty! I have to have messed up the amount of seasoning that went into the butter somehow.

This recipe will get you really close. This might sound disturbing, but I found if I straight dunk the biscuits in the garlic butter mixture, then they taste exactly like them. Usually, I have to set them on a rack to dry or pop them back in the oven for a few minutes to dry out after their butter bath.
I loved it
Made as directed but would like to try with milk or buttermilk. My girls liked them. We crumbled them in our creamy chicken chili.
Definitely make again.

Too many reviewers suggested the same modifications so that's how I made the biscuits. Added Old Bay Seasoning, added all spices to both batter and butter, and baked an additional 2 minutes after bushing butter on top. My family began the compliments just from the aroma of the oven, then gobbled them up.
Make this a lot just because our family likes biscuits and this never fails.

Really great biscuits (or scones as we call them) . Made a half batch and my wife and I polished them off by ourselves. The second batch (the next day) we reduced the garlic powder and the cheese tast really came through. Quick, simple and fantastic
These are so easy to make an extremely tasty. These are so close to what you get at red lobster my daughters thought I used the box mix.
They turned out amazing! a little slow to cook but one of my families favorite biscuits!

I have made this recipe twice now and both times it was inedible. I followed it exactly and it seems like I have way to much flour or too little milk. I am feeling frustrated but the other reviews have me holding onto hope and I will keep trying.

These were incredible and tasted just like a certain seafood restaurant's chain. I made them exactly as the recipe stated but added the seasonings to the batter as some suggested along with the butter brushed over the top both before and after baking. Ate so many that I'm waiting to make them again or I will definitely be packing on the pounds which is not something I need!!!!!
Very good, quick and easy

Best I have ever baked. Well, first I tried it with self rising flour; not a great idea. Picked up the biscuit mix and they were amazing; so good I actually said something like whoa, I did this. I made my own Old Bay seasoning from this website. Love this a bunch.
